course_title: Special Topics: Political Science: Algorithms in Social Science
class_notes:
COURSE TITLE: Algorithms in Social Science


Algorithms are not only ubiquitous in everyday life: they increasingly shape some of the most important life outcomes, including college admissions, accessing credit, and gaining employment.  This course will introduce students to the theory and practice of algorithmic decision-making in social science.  The course will be graded through written assignments and culminate in a final paper on a relevant topic of the student's choice.
course_description: Selected topics and problems in political science. Content will vary in successive offerings of this course. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
